message: A call to all the budding consultants out there! With the prize money at stake higher than ever, the Indian Case Challenge this time is receiving an overwhelming response. For those who've still not registered, there's still time to claim the winning title at India's largest case study competition. Follow the link http://bclub.co.in/icc2018/register/. And for those who have already joined the quest, hurry up the submission deadline is 28th Dec, just a week more to go!

message:

Hurry up as the deadline for the first round is 29 December

Pre-Case released!
The wait is over! Business Club, IIT Kharagpur in association with Kshitij, IIT Kharagpur presents the first round of the Indian Case Challenge 2018, one of the biggest case study competitions in India. Gear up to compete with the best minds in the country and prove your business acumen. Confronted with a real life case scenario, just strong business skills and financial know-how won’t be enough. Only those with a spark of creativity and a zeal for realizing business opportunities will make it through. Wishing the best of luck to all participating teams!
The case will be sent to the registered teams via e-mail. Last date of submission for the preliminary round is 28th December 2017.
If you have not registered yet, head over to: http://bclub.co.in/icc2018/register/

This is to remind that the due date for RBI’s essay writing competition is approaching. All essays must be submitted by the 5th of December in a PDF format. It must include the team members’ names, institute’s name and a summary in the beginning.

As they all say, "The pen is mightier than the sword", Business Club, IIT Kharagpur in association with the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) brings to you an outstanding opportunity to showcase your writing talent.
Participate in this essay writing competition with your team of 3-4 members and submit an essay of 2000 words on the topic "Can FinTech revolutionise access to finance in India?' The zonal round will be held in Kolkata on 2nd February, 2018. The winning team stands a chance to win Rs 1,00,000/- and a 3-month internship opportunity in RBI in any department of their choice. The team placed second would receive a cash prize of Rs 50,000/- while the other two national finalists would receive a cash prize of Rs 25,000/-. The regional and zonal finalists shall be awarded a cash prize of Rs 10,000/- and Rs 15,000/- respectively. The last date of submission is 5th December, 2017.

Head over to this link to register: http://tinyurl.com/RBI-PC-2018-register

In Saudi Arabia, 11 princes were arrested and some big strides have been made towards liberalization of women. A trend has been observed between the price of oil and political stability in the oil producing countries. It was the case with Nigeria, Russia and even the Netherlands where the abundance of natural resources led to economic problems. Read our blog for more information.

story: Business Club, IIT Kharagpur shared Scroll's video.
message: Business Club, IIT Kharagpur shared Scroll's video. More than 90% of the fireworks Indians use during Diwali comes from a small south Indian town in Tamil Nadu. How did that happen?

Business Club, IIT Kharagpur, is holding it's first open house of this academic year. A powerful software by IBM, SPSS is the go-to tool for all things statistics. SPSS, an all time favorite of analysts when it comes to deriving insights from data, has obliged us by holding an informative workshop this weekend. All the Analytics enthusiasts willing to turn some gears in their skill sets are welcome to join us this Saturday from 10.30 am at S. N. Bose Auditorium, beside F-127.

The World Bank, in its own words, has two ambitious goals:
“To end extreme poverty within a generation and boost shared prosperity”
The World Bank, ever since its establishment has been viewed as a beacon of hope to a developing nation’s faltering economy. How have the World Bank projects fared? Have they improved the living standards or robbed people of the basic resources they once had? Read on to find out.

The Saudi Royal family has ruled a decision that may change the lives of millions of women in Saudi Arabia. The decision to let women drive is being praised by human rights activists and industries alike. It is not only a step towards equality for women in Saudi Arabia but also an opportunity for the automotive industry to explore more customers. However, as positive as it may seem, a decision helping thousands of women may hurt giant service providers like Uber. Read on to find out more.

The Saudi Royal family has ruled a decision that may change the lives of millions of women in Saudi Arabia. The decision to let women drive is being praised by human rights activists and industries alike. It is not only a step towards equality for women in Saudi Arabia but also an opportunity for the automotive industry to explore more customers. However, as positive as it may seem, a decision helping thousands of women may hurt giant service providers like Uber. Read on to find out more.

The Saudi Royal family has ruled a decision that may change the lives of millions of women in Saudi Arabia. The decision to let women drive is being praised by human rights activists and industries alike. It is not only a step towards equality for women in Saudi Arabia but also an opportunity for the automotive industry to explore more customers. However, as positive as it may seem, a decision helping thousands of women may hurt giant service providers like Uber. Read on to find out more.

A big decision coming from the Saudi Royal family is definitely a life changing one for millions of women of Saudi Arabia. Hailing it a big success, the human rights activists think that it will make the women of Saudi Arabia more independent. On the other hand, the decision is being seen as an opportunity for the automotive industry. The decision has opened customers counting to almost half the population of the Gulf nation. Now that women can drive, the decision appears to be a threat for the cab hailing services like Uber which also suffered a major setback by its license suspension in London. Read on to find out the impact of the decision in the automotive industry in the country.

While the Indian government may have touted great economic impacts of demonetization and GST that would help India move forward, many economists were not convinced. Once such economist predicted the pain that demonetization would cause, and his predictions for the future look just as bleak. Read on to find out more.

Westeros may be a fictional world, but its economics could have been very plausible just a few centuries ago. With a dynamic world, containing powerful institutions and wealthy families, Game of Thrones has an economy that draws a parallel to our own. Read on to find out more.

Parle-G has been the "family biscuit” of every other Indian household, since the 1940s. Have you ever wondered how the initial days of the indigenous biscuit brand were like? Take a walk back in time to find more about how Parle grew from a small cattle shed to become one of the biggest FMCG players in the Indian market.

https://yourstory.com/2017/08/parle-g-biscuits-swadeshi-movement/?utm_source=FB&utm_medium=Post

We at Business Club, IIT Kharagpur, would like to extend a warm welcome to all the incoming freshers. College is an important milestone and we wish you all the very best as you take your first steps in this journey. You will be presented with an array of opportunities and experiences along the way, make sure you make the best of them!

story: Business Club, IIT Kharagpur added 10 new photos — with Harsh Agarwal and 9 others.
message:
A leader is the one who knows the way, goes the way and shows the way. We are proud to present the team of Business Club, IIT Kharagpur for the academic year 2017-2018.
We would like to thank our outgoing batch for their invaluable guidance and we assure them we will take the club to greater heights.

Last November’s demonetisation wasn’t the first currency struggle that mankind has faced. People have faced currency shortages even in the 1970s but back then, the Irish devised an innovative currency partly based on trust. Confused? Read on to find out about a beautiful form of ancient currency followed by an explanation of the solution that the Irish came up with.

Tinder may seem like a simple tool with primitive ruling functions that we look up to, when we want to lose the ‘single’ status. But did you know that Tinder functions more like a free market with the same complex psychological and physical decision-making practices? In fact, it may be operating even better than today’s average market economy. Interested? We bet you are!
